newsitem.title: GERMANY: Dasa says Lagardere deal by 1998.
newsitem.headline: Dasa says Lagardere deal by 1998.

text.p: An alliance reached on Wednesday between Germany's Daimler-Benz Aerospace AG (DASA) and France's Lagardere is expected to be in place at the latest by 1998, Dasa chief executive Manfred Bischoff said.
"We hope to have this deal in place possibly during this year and at the latest by the middle of next year," Bischoff told Reuters on Thursday.

But Bischoff also said Lagardere's bid to buy Thomson-CSF, which is being offered for privatisation in France, could alter some parts of the agreement between Dasa, a unit of industrial group Daimler-Benz AG, and Lagardere.

If Lagardere were not to receive the go-ahead on its Thomson bid, then Bischoff predicted there could be some fundamental changes in the plans for the two groups' joint venture on defense electronics.
But Bischoff said that this did not apply to satellite technology.
Bischoff also said the deal should largely be financed without any cash transactions.
"No money will flow in this deal," Bischoff said, adding later, however, that Lagardere would need to pay something for the planned 30 percent stake in Dasa's missile unit LFK.
Lagadere's bid for Thomson will in no way involve Dasa, Bischoff said.
"We will not pay for anything nor will be finance anything," Bischoff said.
The planned joint venture is also not expected to cost any jobs in Germany, Bischoff added.
